text: 5563/18 AT/st 1 E 2B EN Council of the European Union Brussels, 26 January 2018 (OR. en) 5563/18 ENER 26 CLIMA 11 CODEC 84 Interinstitutional File: 2016/0375 (COD) NOTE From: General Secretariat of the Council To: Delegations No. Cion doc.: 15090/1/16 ENER 412 CLIMA 167 IA 123 CODEC 1788 REV 1 + ADD 1 REV 1 Subject: Proposal for a REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on the Governance of the Energy Union, amending Directive 94/22/EC, Directive 98/70/EC, Directive 2009/31/EC, Regulation (EC) No 663/2009, Regulation (EC) No 715/2009, Directive 2009/73/EC, Council Directive 2009/119/EC, Directive 2010/31/EU, Directive 2012/27/EU, Directive 2013/30/EU and Council Directive (EU) 2015/652 and repealing Regulation (EU) No 525/2013 - Preparation of first trilogue Delegations will find in Annex the four-column table. At the meeting of the Working Party on Energy on 1 February, delegations will be invited to indicate their opinion on the EP amendments, as well as on the draft Presidency compromise suggestions in the fourth column, in order to prepare the Coreper meeting scheduled for 14 February. The Presidency compromise suggestions are merely a basis for discussion in the Working Party, and in no way prejudge the positions that delegations will take . The fourth column contains first Presidency compromise suggestions, predominantly of a technical nature; in that column, bold italics underlined text indicates text as it was proposed by the EP; please note that the EP text is provisional, pending the publication of the official consolidated text of the EP opinion.

5563/18 AT/st 2 E 2B EN Underlined bold text indicates first compromise text proposed by the Presidency in response to EP amendments to allow for structured discussion in the Energy Working Party. Where the fourth column is empty or marked " Maintain Council GA ", at this stage, it is proposed that Council maintains its position as reflected in the third column. " To be discussed " means parts of the text where additional guidance is necessary from the Energy Working Party. The aim of the discussion in the Energy Working Party will be to allow the delegations to express their preliminary observations on the text adopted by the Parliament, and to structure the initial approach of the Presidency during the negotiations with the focus on the first compromise proposals of the Presidency as presented in the fourth column. Delegations may send written comments by 1 February at the latest. Delegations are invited to comment on inter alia the following issues from the proposed texts by the Parliament: - the non-linear progressive trajectory proposed by the EP, including the reference points and the percentages to be achieved at them; and whether or not to describe the trajectory in an Annex (Ia); - the division by the EP of “regional level” into “macro-regional and regional” (in particular in the context of - cooperation) and of “national level” into “national and local level”; - the EP proposal to replace "updates" of national plans with new plans; - the EP proposal to link the deadline for Commission recommendations to the deadline for the submission of the final plans; - the EP proposal to add "investment strategies" as a key element of the national plans; - the EP proposals on: = a general framework for long-term climate and energy strategies ( cf. i.a. AM 277) = "energy efficiency first" = "energy poverty" = a global carbon budget for the Union = carbon removals from sinks = a "Multilevel Climate and Energy Dialogue Platform" = additional reporting requirements = etc. N.B. Where footnotes from the Commission proposal remain unchanged across the four columns, the footnote is only reproduced once. ___________________________
